text: [Music]
hello I'm chef job net switch for food
wishes dot-com and this is the craft
cooking video challenge this is my
version of crafty shepherd's pie look at
how delicious that looks and where do
you see the inside all right we're going
to start with some potatoes this is a
pound and a quarter you can use any kind
I like using Yukon Gold because they
already look like they have butter in
them we're going to add those to water
to cover three cloves of garlic I'm
going to put a pinch of salt in that's
up to you we're going to put that onto
boil we're also going to get our other
ingredients ready I have craft sharp
cheddar look at 100 calories and I also
have some nuts in the KA silent light
sour cream some ground beef that's extra
lean one pound and four cups of thawed
frozen vegetables I'm using peas carrots
and corn kind of a traditional mixture
and here's the secret ingredient Raft
roasted red pepper Italian dressing
instead of ketchup the secret ingredient
don't tell anybody all right I want to
see this all over the internet so in a
saute pan a non-stick pan we're going to
brown the beef over medium heat and then
we're going to stir in two tablespoons
of flour cook that for a couple minutes
we're going to add 3/4 of a cup of
low-sodium beef broth all right two or
three tablespoons of that red pepper
dressing so delicious and you know what
else hats good for salad all right we're
going to stir in our vegetables and that
flour is going to combine with the
juices from the meat and the vegetables
all right that's going to thicken up
nicely see that you're going to cook at
about five minutes then I want you to
put it in a casserole dish and then
we're going to wait for our potatoes
alright for the potatoes we're going to
drain those very well once they're
tender look at that clove of garlic it's
all soft it's going to be so good we're
going to smash that by the way that's a
secret to non lumpy potatoes mash them a
little bit before you put in your wet
ingredients I'm going to put in a
quarter cup of my craft sharp cheddar
cheese 3/4 of a cup of my nuts in the K
is silent light sour cream we're going
to mash that in real well and when it's
nice and smooth you can add a little
pinch of salt if you want we're going to
pile that in the center of our
shepherd's pie and then with a fork
we're going to drag it from the center
to the edges to form the top layer that
way we don't get any
vegetables and meat in the topic we're
going to use the fork to make some marks
on top that will make it look nice when
it cooks little extra surface area we're
going to top with a quarter cup of the
cheese it's going to go in a 375 degree
oven until it's done about 20 minutes
it's going to be deliciously golden and
the cheese is going to be melted and
that's it you're going to let it cool
for at least 15 minutes before you serve
it so it kind of you know relaxes and
after a hard day work tending to the
flock there's nothing like coming in and
sitting down to a plate shepherd's pie I
really hope you give that a try I got
this recipe from Kraft Foods calm so go
